sources.title: In Old Santa Fe
sources.description: Big city gangsters arrive at the dude ranch and trouble begins for ranch hand Kentucky (Ken Maynard). He loses his horse Tarzan in a rigged horse race and gets framed for murder.

sources.title: In Old Santa Fe (1934)
sources.description: Gangster Chandler and his accomplice Tracy arrive at a dude ranch. Cowboy Kentucky arrives at the same time. When Tracy double-crosses his boss and has the stage robbed, Kentucky finds the outlaws and brings them in. Tracy frames him for the murder of the driver but his pal Cactus gets him out of jail. He returns just as Chandler shoots Tracy and Kentucky finds himself arrested for another murder. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/in-old-santa-fe-1934/

sources.title: In Old Santa Fe (1934) KEN MAYNARD
sources.description:
Stars: Ken Maynard,  Evalyn Knapp, Gabby Hayes, Gene Autry
Directed by: David Howard

An innocent ranch hand loses his horse in a rigged race and gets framed for the murder of a stagecoach driver.

Trivia: This film is essentially Gene Autry's screen test. After Ken Maynard's quarrelsomeness got him fired by Mascot Pictures' head Nat Levine, Autry won his first starring role in The Phantom Empire (1935), originally intended to star Maynard.

metadata.Plot: Gangster Chandler and his accomplice Tracy arrive at a dude ranch. Cowboy Kentucky arrives at the same time. When Tracy double-crosses his boss and has the stage robbed, Kentucky finds the outlaws and brings them in. Tracy frames him for the murder of the driver but his pal Cactus gets him out of jail. He returns just as Chandler shoots Tracy and Kentucky finds himself arrested for another murder.
metadata.Writer: Wallace MacDonald, John Rathmell, Colbert Clark
